intro: Acosta subsericans, commonly known as the slender acosta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Acosta subsericans is often found in regions with tropical or subtropical climates.
